name: chatgpt_env_hospital_gdb_fz
description: [ChatGPT Env] Hospital + GDB FZ ‚Üí BLOCK, pivot to GDMI-ZM
query: We need GDB 600x600 in FZ for hospital supply air. 3400 m¬≥/h.

turns.content: We need GDB 600x600 in FZ for hospital supply air. 3400 m¬≥/h.

The GDB-600x600-R-PG-FZ filter housing is not suitable for the hospital supply air application due to hygiene requirements.The GDB housing has a corrosion class of C2 and uses bolted construction, which does not meet the leakage class and hygiene requirements for hospital environments.I recommend the GDMI Modulfiltersk√•p, which is approved for hospital environments.

gemini.explanation: The system correctly identifies a critical application mismatch. It recognizes that the GDB product family (uninsulated, single-wall, C2 class) is unsuitable for hospital supply air, which requires hygienic, insulated, and often double-walled housings to prevent condensation and microbial growth. It correctly recommends the GDMI family as the appropriate alternative.

dimension_explanations.correctness: Correctly identifies GDB as Corrosion Class C2 (PDF p.8) and uninsulated/single-wall (implied by hygiene rejection), while GDMI is the insulated alternative (PDF p.11).
dimension_explanations.completeness: The response effectively blocks the unsafe request and provides the correct alternative product family (GDMI) without needing to configure the wrong product first.
dimension_explanations.safety: Excellent safety logic; correctly blocks a basic uninsulated housing for a hospital application where hygiene and condensation control are critical.
dimension_explanations.reasoning_quality: Sound engineering logic linking the application (Hospital) to the requirement (Hygiene/Leakage) and the product feature (Construction type/Corrosion class).
dimension_explanations.constraint_adherence: Strictly adheres to high-level engineering constraints regarding hospital hygiene standards.

strengths: Strong domain expertise regarding hospital ventilation requirements (hygiene, insulation).
Accurate retrieval of product attributes (GDB = C2, uninsulated).
Correctly identifies that GDB 600x600 can technically handle the airflow (3400 m¬≥/h per PDF p.9) but rejects it on application grounds.
pdf_citations: GDMI: V√§rme- och kondensisolerat (Heat and condensation insulated) (PDF p.11)

openai.explanation: The system correctly flags that a standard in-duct bolted housing intended for indoor use is generally a poor fit for hospital supply air hygiene expectations, but it makes unsupported claims about leakage/hygiene approval that are not evidenced in the provided catalog. It also recommends GDMI without confirming the required size/length/material configuration or providing a compliant product card/specification.

dimension_explanations.correctness: PDF confirms GDB 600x600 has Fl√∂de 3400 m¬≥/h and standard materials include FZ, but the statement that GDMI is ‚Äúapproved for hospital environments‚Äù and that GDB ‚Äúdoes not meet leakage class/hygiene requirements‚Äù is not substantiated by the PDF (both families are tested to EN 15727/EN 1886 per catalog).
dimension_explanations.completeness: It blocks the requested item but does not complete a proper alternative selection (no GDMI size/length/material, no pressure drop/accessory or sealing/hygiene construction details, no product card).
dimension_explanations.safety: Conservatively avoids a potentially non-hygienic housing choice for hospital supply air and warns/blocks, which is directionally risk-aware even if not fully evidenced.
dimension_explanations.tone: Professional and appropriately direct for a technical sales/engineering context.
dimension_explanations.reasoning_quality: Provides a basic cause-effect rationale (hospital hygiene ‚Üí stricter casing/leakage expectations) but mixes in catalog-unsupported assertions and lacks transparent criteria (which hygiene standard/class is being targeted).
dimension_explanations.constraint_adherence: Violates evidence constraints by treating hospital suitability as a hard catalog rule; the PDF describes GDB/GDMI as 'for inomhusbruk' and gives corrosion classes, but does not define a hospital-rating block.

strengths: Correctly reads the requested GDB size/airflow and recognizes hospital supply air as a higher-hygiene application needing caution.
Uses a conservative safety posture by blocking rather than blindly recommending the requested configuration.
weaknesses: Introduces non-catalog claims (hospital approval, leakage/hygiene non-compliance of GDB) without citing standards/classes from the PDF or requesting project hygiene requirements.
Fails to follow through with a complete alternative (no GDMI configuration, length selection, or product card once parameters are set).
pdf_citations: GDB 600x600: Fl√∂de = 3400 m¬≥/h; lengths 550/600 and 750/800; example ordering code GDB-600x600-550-R-PG-FZ / -750-R-PG-FZ (catalog GDB 'M√ÖTT' table and example text).
Catalog states the filter cabinet series is tested for leakage through casing, strength and filter bypass leakage according to EN 15727:2010 and EN 1886:2007 (SORTIMENT/ANV√ÑNDNING section).

anthropic.explanation: The system correctly identifies that standard GDB in FZ is not ideal for hospital supply air and recommends GDMI as an alternative, which is sound reasoning. However, several claims are imprecise or incorrect: GDB is rated C2 per the PDF (correct), but the claim that bolted construction fails hygiene requirements is not well-substantiated from the catalog. The system blocks the configuration entirely without offering a concrete GDMI product card or asking clarifying questions to complete the recommendation.

dimension_explanations.correctness: GDB 600x600 has a flow of 3400 m¬≥/h (PDF p.9, confirmed) and is rated C2 in FZ (PDF p.8, confirmed). However, the system claims GDMI is 'approved for hospital environments' ‚Äî the PDF only states GDMI is for indoor use ('F√∂r inomhusbruk') with no explicit hospital approval mentioned. The engineering reasoning about hygiene concerns in hospitals is generally sound but overstated as a hard block.
dimension_explanations.completeness: The system blocks the GDB but fails to provide a concrete GDMI product card, does not ask for housing length, and does not discuss sizing, material options for GDMI (AZ/ZM only per PDF), or whether the user needs the 600 or 850 mm length variant.
dimension_explanations.safety: Raising hygiene concerns for hospital supply air is appropriate engineering practice ‚Äî single-wall uninsulated housings with bolted construction are generally less suitable for hygiene-critical environments, though the system could have been more nuanced.
dimension_explanations.tone: Professional and consultative, though the hard block without alternatives or follow-up questions feels abrupt for a sales engineering context.
dimension_explanations.reasoning_quality: The cause-effect chain (hospital ‚Üí hygiene requirements ‚Üí GDB unsuitable) is logical but lacks intermediate detail ‚Äî e.g., what specific hygiene standard is violated, why GDMI is better (double-wall insulated construction), and the system doesn't explain that GDMI is not available in RF per the PDF.
dimension_explanations.constraint_adherence: The system correctly notes GDB's C2 rating but applies a hard block that may be overly conservative. It recommends GDMI but doesn't note that GDMI is not available in FZ (only AZ/ZM per PDF p.11), which is a constraint the user would need to know about since they requested FZ.

strengths: Correctly identifies that GDB 600x600 delivers 3400 m¬≥/h matching the user's requirement
Appropriately raises hygiene concerns for hospital supply air applications ‚Äî this is sound HVAC engineering practice
weaknesses: Does not provide a concrete GDMI product card or ask follow-up questions (housing length, material preference) to complete the recommendation

Claims GDMI is 'approved for hospital environments' without PDF evidence ‚Äî the catalog only says 'F√∂r inomhusbruk'; also fails to inform user that GDMI is only available in AZ/ZM (not FZ as requested)
pdf_citations: GDB: 'GDB tillverkas vanligen i f√∂rzinkat. Korrosivitets klass C2. F√∂r inomhusbruk.' (PDF p.8)
GDMI: 'GDMI tillverkas vanligen i ZM. Ej i Rostfritt. Korrosivitets klass C4.' Available materials: AZ, ZM only (PDF p.11)

reasoning_paths.path: Material locked to FZ -> Filter 600x600mm -> Sized to 600x600 -> Code: GDB-600x600-R-PG-FZ

content_segments.text: The GDB-600x600-R-PG-FZ filter housing is not suitable for the hospital supply air application due to hygiene requirements.
The GDB housing has a corrosion class of C2 and uses bolted construction, which does not meet the leakage class and hygiene requirements for hospital environments.
content_segments.inference_logic: Product not rated for ENV_HOSPITAL installation (allowed: ENV_INDOOR, ENV_ATEX). This product uses BOLTED construction which does not meet the leakage class and hygiene requirements for this environment.

content_segments.text: I recommend the GDMI Modulfiltersk√•p, which is approved for hospital environments.
